result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Michael Cameron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Michael Cameron is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Michael Cameron was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CM749.
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 18, 2016 by 4:00 p.m.
Court notes 30 days credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CM749

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Michael Cameron
Current: 1588 Leila Lane, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2016)
Prior: 310 Arlene Court, Hudson, WI 54016 United States
From def in writing. mw

CO: Cameron for SRN, RPR: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Barbara K Miller DF: Joshua M Cameron appeared. Case called at 11:18. Includes 15TR5674, 15TR5675, 15CM639, 15CM749,  16CM01, 16CM25, 16CM121. DE has completed inpatient treatment and is doing aftercare with Valley Counseling.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2  in 15CM639 without the enhancer and G to Ct 2 in 15CM749 and NC to 15TR5675 . Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2  in 15CM639 without the enhancer, Ct 2 in 15CM749 and 15TR5675. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM639 and Ct 1 in 15CM749 and 15TR5674. Court outright dismisses 16CM01, 16CM121 and 16CM25. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

On 15CM639 and 15CM749
Sentence W/H 
1 year probation on each concurrent with conditions:
- Court notes 30 days credit if DE is revoked. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Follow through with any recommended treatment 
- Costs of $243 on 15CM749 only. 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200 on each count.
Apply bond on file. 

De to report to probation by 4:00 today. 
On 15TR5675
- $761.50
- 6 mo revocation
-  1 year. IID
- AODA and driver's safety plan

DE to meet with the payment clerk today.
Plea hearing on July 18, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew Hartung DF ATTY: Barbara K Miller DF: Joshua Michael Cameron appeared. Case called at 1:27. Miller updates the court, family is currently looking for after care treatment. There is no out date as of yet. Bonds continue in all files.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Michael Cameron
Current: 1909 Beach Blvd #202, Jacksonville Beach, FL 32250 United States  (Effective: 03-03-2016)
Prior: 369 Casperson Drive, Hudson, WI 54016
Status conference at 04-25-2016 09:00 am

**AMENDED**
Includes 15CM639, 15CM749,  16CM01, 16CM25, 16CM121.

- DE is to leave for Beaches Treatment in FL tomorrow 03-04-2016.

- If DE discharged against staff advice or obsconds from treatment DE to immediately report to St. Croix County Jail.
  
- Random and regular testing.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE to report on 03-04-2016 to St. Croix County Jail by 9:00am to be tested. 

- DE is to confirm with St. Croix County by fax or letter no later than Mon. 03-07-2016 by 5:00pm his reception at the treatment facility. 

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  RAcel Cameron and the family.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Nieskes DF ATTY: Barbara K Miller DF: Joshua Michael Cameron appeared from jail. Case called at 9:45. Includes 15TR5674, 15TR5675, 15CM639, 15CM749,  16CM01, 16CM25, 16CM121. ADA Nieskes updates the court. DE has a plane ticket to leave for treatment in FL tomorrow at 1:15pm. After 3 month treatment is concluded DE will be going to CA for 9 months to continue aftercare. There is a joint recommendation to modify bond to allow DE to attend treatment. Court authorized DE appearance by phone for next STC.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 03-03-2016 09:45 am
